sentences: Charles Christopher Sligh (born April 13, 1978) is an American singer, songwriter, producer and pastor who was a finalist on the sixth season of American Idol, finishing in tenth place.
Charles Christopher Sligh (born April 13, 1978) is an American singer, songwriter, producer and pastor who was a finalist on the sixth season of American Idol, finishing in tenth place.
He has released 14 albums since 2001 as a solo artist, with his band Half Past Forever or with his former church's musical entity, Shoreline Music.
He has released 14 albums since 2001 as a solo artist, with his band Half Past Forever or with his former church's musical entity, Shoreline Music.
He also starred in October Baby.
Early years ==
The family moved to Durham, North Carolina when Sligh was three years old but soon moved to Wiesbaden, Germany; where Chuck ministered to American troops.

Sligh began his college study in pre-law at Pensacola Christian College in Florida, Sligh transferred in his sophomore year to Bob Jones University in Greenville, South Carolina intending to major in music.

Sligh was eliminated from American Idol on March 28, 2007 and is therefore the tenth-place singer in Season Six.

The next day, Sligh said that he had not sought to win the competition and that he had considered quitting the show two weeks before, but stayed on the show in order to make it into the top ten so that he could go on tour with the other top ten finalists.

2007-2008: Running Back to You =
In November 2007, Sligh stated that he had signed a solo deal with Brash Music, an Atlanta-based independent label that is distributed through Warner Bros, ADA distribution, and Word Distribution.
Sligh's album was released on May 6, 2008 by Brash Music.
The first official single, "Empty Me," was added to radio playlists February 22, 2008 and reached number six on the Billboard Hot Christian Songs Charts.
The album debuted on the Billboard 200 at 190 with 4,000 copies sold the first week, the top Christian debut for the week.
The album debuted on the Billboard 200 at 190 with 4,000 copies sold the first week, the top Christian debut for the week.
It has sold 54,000 copies in the U.S. as of October 2009.

USA Today called Sligh "the most musically ambitious Idol to date" and popular Christian website Jesus Freak Hideout gave the album 4.5 stars (out of 5) and called it "...one of the year's best albums".

USA Today called Sligh "the most musically ambitious Idol to date" and popular Christian website Jesus Freak Hideout gave the album 4.5 stars (out of 5) and called it "...one of the year's best albums".
Through 2008, Sligh toured relentlessly, with over 115 shows and over 150 other various appearances (radio, TV, web interviews).
In August and September 2008, he headlined the Back to School Tour.
In December 2008, Sligh toured with NewSong, on the NewSong Christmas celebration tour.
In December 2008, Sligh toured with NewSong, on the NewSong Christmas celebration tour.
The tour hit 18 cities from December 1‚Äì22, 2008.
In March and April 2009, Sligh toured with [1] Natalie Grant and Meredith Andrews on the Make It Matter Tour.
In April 2009, Sligh co-wrote a song called "Here Comes Goodbye" with Clint Lagerberg (also the cowriter of Sligh's first single "Empty Me").
The song went number one after 12 weeks on the Billboard Hot Country Charts.
In May 2009, Sligh announced that he had parted ways with his label Brash Music and was "negotiating with a major label" for his next deal.
His second album "Anatomy Of The Broken" was released in September, 2010 on Word Records.
From September to November 2009, Sligh completed his 2nd Annual Back to School tour, a co-headlining effort with Aaron Shust.
In November 2009 Sligh's first Christmas album became available on iTunes.
In November 2009 Sligh's first Christmas album became available on iTunes.
In November he also announced details of his upcoming album, titled "The Anatomy of Broken," which was released on September 14, 2010.
In November he also announced details of his upcoming album, titled "The Anatomy of Broken," which was released on September 14, 2010.
Sligh made his acting debut in the movie October Baby as B-Mac.
In 2011, Sligh parted with Warner Brothers/Word Records.
He took a job at Rocky Mountain Christian Church in Niwot, Colorado as Worship Pastor.
In 2013, Sligh and his family moved to Austin, Texas, where Chris acted as Worship Pastor and later Creative Director at Shoreline Church.
In 2013, Sligh and his family moved to Austin, Texas, where Chris acted as Worship Pastor and later Creative Director at Shoreline Church.
Sligh built a songwriting and production arm for the church called Shoreline Music and featured on the album No Height, No Depth, which came out in 2015.
In 2016, Sligh and family moved to Chicago, Illinois, where he acted as Executive Creative Director at Parkview Christian Church.
At the end of 2016, Sligh left his job at the church around the time of releasing Mighty Roar / Healing Flood in December 2016.

The album received positive reviews by major Christian publications: it received 4 of 5 stars by New Release Today  4 of 5 stars by CCM Magazine  and 3.5 of 5 star by JesusFreakHideout  plus a 9/10 rating by CrossRhythms Magazine.
The album also garnered Sligh a nomination for JesusFreakHideout's Pop Album of the Year.
In 2017, Sligh returned to touring and played over forty shows.
In April 2018, Sligh released A Modern Liturgy.
In 2018, Sligh produced the majority of an EP for Curt Anderson  and wrote and produced new artist Jenna Long
In 2019, Sligh partnered with Worship Tutorials to release a series of videos.
